N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 18 ยง 300.10 - Legal services on a fee-for-service basis

State Regulations
(a) If the appropriating body of a social
services district has so authorized and made provision therefor, a local social
services commissioner may obtain necessary legal services on a fee-for-service
basis or other appropriate basis for the purpose of obtaining support from
spouses and parents, recovering costs of public assistance and care granted, and establishing paternity. Such services shall not be subject to reimbursement
by the department unless they are provided in accordance with a plan submitted
to and approved by the department. (b) The plan required by subdivision (a) of
this section shall demonstrate: (1)
the
volume of legal work in the local district; (2)
that the volume of legal work is such as
not to require full-time legal staff or that full-time legal staff is not
available in sufficient numbers to handle the volume of work; and
(3)
that the cost to the local district of
obtaining legal services on a fee-for-service basis or other appropriate basis
will not exceed the cost to the local district on a unit basis of obtaining the
same or a similar type and amount of services from a full-time attorney or a
law guardian. Notes
